alert.note: Alert for Okaloosa (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 14 at 1:22PM EDT until July 14 at 3:15PM EDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR SOUTH CENTRAL OKALOOSA COUNTY... At 1222 PM CDT, Local law enforcement and county officials reported ongoing flash flooding across the warned area. Water is over numerous roads in the area due to the 3 to 5 inches of rain that has fallen recently. Flash flooding is ongoing and is expected to continue through the early afternoon hours. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Wright, Fort Walton Beach, Mary Esther, Ocean City and Cinco Bayou. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
